1.instruction: Convert the existing web-based Vastu architect application at /workspace/react_template/ to a full desktop application using Electron. Tasks include: 1) Set up Electron main process and renderer configuration, 2) Integrate SQLite database for local project storage, 3) Implement real Ollama LLM integration for local AI processing, 4) Add desktop-specific features (file system access, native menus, window management), 5) Configure build system for desktop app packaging, 6) Ensure all 3D visualization and Vastu features work in desktop environment, 7) Create desktop installer/executable, 8) Test offline functionality with local LLM. Maintain all existing MVP features while adding desktop capabilities and local LLM processing.

2.instruction: Update the system architecture at /workspace/vastu_architect_ai_system_design.md to support local deployment with local LLMs and desktop application architecture. Key changes needed: 1) Replace cloud-based LLM services with local LLM integration (Ollama, LM Studio, or similar), 2) Convert from web-based to desktop application architecture using Electron or Tauri, 3) Update database architecture for local SQLite/embedded databases, 4) Modify the system to run entirely offline/locally, 5) Update deployment strategy from cloud to local installation, 6) Ensure 3D rendering works locally with WebGL/OpenGL, 7) Update collaboration features for local network sharing, 8) Revise security model for local desktop environment. Create updated architecture diagrams and technical specifications for the desktop application with local LLM support.
